result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier K. Eveland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation he may now be serving.

miscConds.notes: Paid from bond on file.  Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Seek and maintain employment.  Not to terminate his employment without his agent's prior approval.
Submit to a mental health evaluation, and comply with any recommendations.

Defendant shall have absolutely no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, OR BY ANY OTHER MEANS WHATSOEVER with L.P.L., her family, her residence, the school she attends, or any where she is located.  

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.  

Comply with any treatment or counseling his agent recommends, including but not limited to criminal thinking.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Credit for 441 days served.  AMENDED 11/27/19.  Credit for 442 days served.

superMiscConds.notes: All costs were previously paid out of the bond on file per the original judgment of conviction.

Must seek and maintain full-time employment which is satisfactory to your probation agent when your agent deems it's appropriate with counseling/programming.  Defendant  must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol and other drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant must submit to random urinalysis by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.  Defendant must submit to random PBT's by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.
Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person with L.P.L., her family, or her residence.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming, including AODA, mental health, and cognitive behavioral health, as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessments, and your probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Must comply with any other recommendations of your agent.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other extended supervision or probation serving.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Copy sent to defendant

Defendant appears in person in custody with counsel Matthew Krische.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  No changes or corrections to the revocation summary noted by counsel.  No victim on this case.  The other cases set for hearings today were notified but no one is present.  16CF192, 16CF205, 16CF193, 16CF194 - defense will be filing a request for substitution on those cases which will be filed tomorrow.  Court finds the requests for substitution are timely made.  ADA Inlow states the defendant has been revoked on other cases in the past.  State recommends a 5 - 7 year prison/ES sentence, CIP and SAP eligbility with 441 jail credit.  Attorney Krische makes a statement to the Court and requests a sentence of 2 years initial confinement with 2 - 4 years extended supervision with 441 days credit and that he be allowed to participate in CIP and SAP.  Defendant does not excercise his right to allocution.  Court orders a 6 years bifurcated sentence of 3 years initial confinement with 3 years extended supervision.  Conditions of extended supervision are:  Must submit to a risk and needs assessment including AODA, mental health needs, and cognitive behavioral health needs.  Must sign all releases necessary for agent to verify compliance with treatment/counseling.  Must submit to random testing for drugs and alcohol.  No contact of any kind with L.P.L, her family, or her residence.  Must pay the costs of the action.  Must seek and obtain employment when agent deems appropriate and must not leave that employment without the permision of his agent.  Court finds eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.  Grants 441 days sentence credit.  Court orders a civil judgment may be entered for costs after the agent provides documentation to the Clerk of Court as to what is still unpaid.  DNA should already be on file.
ROAW sent to Judge electronically.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 14, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State. Defendant appeared through Attorney Krische and Attorney Gardner.  Attorney Krische says he has an agreement on his cases.  Set for a plea.  PSI will be requested. 

Attorney Gardner has a jury trial in front of Judge Goodman on another case.  Set those cases for STC on 1/23 at 3 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 15, 2016 at 11:30 am.
from DOC
DNA Proof of Submission form

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Gardner.  Not requesting PSI on this case.  State recommended:  4 years total.  2 years initial confinement,  and 2 years extended supervision.  Court questioned amount of credit.  State responded.  Attorney Gardner recommended probation, with conditions the court deems appropriate.  2 years.  Local jail.  Has about 16 months credit. Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  State says there is 312 days sentence credit.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 2 years probation.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  1 year jail.    Absolutely have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means,  with L.P.L. , her family, school where she attends, her residence.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  s/m employment.  Not to terminate without agent's prior approval.  Mental Health evaluation, and comply with recommendations.  Comply with any treatment agent recommends regarding his criminal thinking.  Subject to random testing by his agent. DNA sample and surcharge. CC.  Credit for 312 days on the conditional jail time.
DNA submission form.
Sentencing hearing on August 4, 2016 at 11:30 am.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Gardner.  Plead no contest to count 1.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Court confirmed the priors with the defendant and attorney for the repeater allegation.  Felony warnings given.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Felony Bail Jumping, contrary to 946.49(1)(b).  Set sentencing with JA.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Gardner.  Set for a 1 hour plea hearing.  JT off.  Global offer made to settle all matters.  Track all other cases with 15CF61.
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on June 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial on July 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on March 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on March 11, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Defendant's
Reading of the information waived.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by court on defendant's behalf.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Gardner.  State called N.G, JASO Detective, sworn.  Witness identified the defendant.  Record reflects identification.  State questioned witness regarding the incident.  Exhibit 1 marked.  Bond.  Exhibit 2 marked.  Clerk's minutes.  Exhibit 3 marked.  CCAP printout.  Exhibits 1, 2 and 3 offered by the State.  No objection.  Admitted.  Exhibit 4 marked.  Pages of Deputy M.'s report.  Exhibit 4 offered by the State.  No objection.  Admitted.  Exhibit 5 marked.  Narrative.  Attorney Gardner questioned the witness.  State redirect.  Attorney Gardner recross.  State moved for bind over.  Defense has no evidence.  Court found probable cause.

Defendant appeared in custody with counsel Robert Gardner.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defense is motioning the Court to reduce the $25,000 cash bond and to rescind the bond forfeiture ordered for the $5000 cash bond signed 12/12/15.  Requesting the $5000 cash bond be reinstated or the $25,000 be reduced.  DA Fox gives argument that there needs to be a sanction for not appearing and the previously ordered cash bond is appropriate and there are also 8 cases in front of Judge Goodman at this time.  Judge Becker reviewed the numerous cases that have had failure to appear warrants issued in the past; doesn't have a credible history that he will appear and he continues to violate the law.  Court orders the $5000 bond forfeiture rescinded and reinstates that bond.  Court orders the $25,000 cash bond is appropriate and will remain as previously ordered.  15CF61, 15CF99, 15CF180 are to be set for preliminary hearing.  Counsel are to schedule for 1 1/2 hours with the J.A. and status on other cases tracking.  15CF99 is the priority case for jury trial.
Preliminary hearing at 03-04-2016 01:30 pm
Motion hearing at 02-19-2016 01:45 pm
Status conference at 02-19-2016 01:45 pm

Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail with counsel, Robert Gardner appearing in person in the courtroom.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Attorney Gardner states he has not been retained on the new case 16CF22 yet but is sure he will be so he's appearing specially today; waives reading of the complaint; requests a preliminary hearing be scheduled within the time limits.  Court set prelim for 2-11-16 at 10:00 for 45 minutes.  15CF61, 15CF99, and 15CF180 will track with this case.
Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail with counsel, Robert Gardner appearing in person in the courtroom.
from Attorney Gardner

Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail without counsel present in the courtroom.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant believes attorney Gardner is representing him on the new case as well as the others he's already on.  Defendant motions the Court to reduce his bond.  DA Fox makes a statement regarding bond.  Court orders that bond will remain as previously ordered.  Defendant is to contact his attorney.  DA Fox believes attorney Gardner has a hearing tomorrow so these cases could be set for tomorrow.  Court sets for 2-9 at 1:00.
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties contained in the new complaint.  Defendant understood.  Previous cash bond ordered forfeited.  New cash bond set.  STC set for 2/8/16 at 9 am.
Status conference at 02-08-2016 09:00 am

Covers case no. 15CF61, 15CF99, 15CF180 and 16CF22.   Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: victim L. P. L. and with females under 18 years of age.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Must be on home arrest at all times, unless approved by the court.  Exceptions:  medical or legal appointments, religious functions or to get groceries.
Status conference at 02-22-2016 03:00 pm

Status conference at 02-01-2016 03:00 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State. Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Gardner.  Set for STC 2/1/16 at 3 pm.  Attorney Gardner may be a little late.  Defendant needs to be here for that hearing.

In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.
